title: Fix browser console warnings: PWA manifest meta tag and icon resource

requirements.summary: Add mobile-web-app-capable meta tag to resolve browser deprecation warning
acceptanceCriteria: <meta name="mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes"> is present in frontend/index.html
No deprecation warning about apple-mobile-web-app-capable appears in the browser console

file_operations.description: Add <meta name="mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes"> tag to the <head> section alongside the existing apple-mobile-web-app-capable meta tag. Place it immediately after the apple-mobile-web-app-capable tag to maintain grouping of PWA-related meta tags.

requirements.summary: Fix PWA manifest icon entries to use valid PNG icons at correct dimensions
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/public/manifest.json references valid PNG icon files at standard PWA sizes (192x192 and 512x512)
No manifest icon error appears in the browser console
The .ico file reference is removed or replaced with a correctly formatted PNG entry

file_operations.description: Update the icons array to reference the generated PNG icon files at frontend/public/assets/generated/app-icon.dim_512x512.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/app-icon-192.dim_192x192.png. Remove or replace any .ico file references (IMG_4505.ico) with these PNG entries. Ensure each icon entry includes src, sizes, type (image/png), and purpose fields following PWA manifest specification.
